dismissalText.long: c Alok Kapali b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Lendl Simmons c Alok Kapali b Rubel Hossain 122 (124b 8x4 2x6 159m) SR: 98.38

dismissalComment.html: such a tame end to a fine innings. Simmons attempts something which is not his strength, moving across his stumps to try and paddle over short fine leg. There's no pace on the ball whatsoever and it lands in short fine leg's lap

headshotImage.caption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Alok Kapali b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Marlon Samuels c Alok Kapali b Rubel Hossain 71 (78b 6x4 2x6 98m) SR: 91.02

dismissalComment.html: caught at deep square leg! Samuels tries to hook a short ball but top edges it. Kapali comes running in from the boundary and takes the catch on the move.

such a tame end to a fine innings. Simmons attempts something which is not his strength, moving across his stumps to try and paddle over short fine leg. There's no pace on the ball whatsoever and it lands in short fine leg's lap
caught at deep square leg! Samuels tries to hook a short ball but top edges it. Kapali comes running in from the boundary and takes the catch on the move.

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught at long-on! Pollard backs away to a fullish ball and slogs, swinging his bat hard, aiming for a six over deep midwicket. He mis-times it and the fielder at long-on runs to his right to take the catch

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Shafiul pitches a slower ball in line with the stumps and angles it across Bravo, who backed away to hit through the off side. He was beaten by the change of pace and the ball clipped off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan not out 67 (58b 2x4 1x6 87m) SR: 115.51

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Danza Hyatt player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danza Hyatt player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Naeem Islam c Hyatt b Russell 52 (82b 4x4 0x6 109m) SR: 63.41

dismissalComment.html: Danza's taken a blinder! Slow offcutter from Naeem, who backs away and swings merrily, but the ball comes on slowly and takes the top edge to fly right up. Hyatt runs back from cover, dives away from the action and takes it with both hands even as he slides along the turf. Supreme stuff.

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Ashraful is on his way already. Blink-and-you-miss innings. Nice lively bouncer from Rampaul, Ashraful goes for a shot he wouldn't have tried if it wasn't the Powerplay, or if the situation wasn't so difficult (though, with Ashraful, it is tough to say). He's cramped for the pull and  Ramdin takes the top edge.

headshotImage.caption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and that's the end of Kapali. Rampaul excels in these skiddy bouncers that come along faster than you'd imagine. Kapali top-edges a pull and it is easily caught well inside the boundary by a pumped up Simmons.

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Kayes' lively hand comes to an end, and it is that man Samuels again. Short ball outside off, it came on faster than he expected and he ended up feathering the cut to the keeper. The Powerplay is doing more bad than good for Bangladesh.
Samuels has taken the Mickey out of the innings. Rahim top-edges the sweep off a flat ball and it nestles in short fine leg's hands. Darren Bravo takes a catch, which is an event by itself.

headshotImage.caption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c †Ramdin b Bishoo 21 (38b 2x4 0x6 50m) SR: 55.26

dismissalComment.html: what a gift. Bishoo strikes with his first ball. It was short, it was wide, and it was barely turning in. Tamim set himself up for a sumptuous cut, and edged it into Ramdin's gloves.

Nice lively bouncer from Rampaul, Ashraful goes for a shot he wouldn't have tried if it wasn't the Powerplay, or if the situation wasn't so difficult (though, with Ashraful, it is tough to say). dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c †Ramdin b Samuels 42 (52b 5x4 0x6 68m) SR: 80.76

dismissalComment.html: Kayes' lively hand comes to an end, and it is that man Samuels again. Short ball outside off, it came on faster than he expected and he ended up feathering the cut to the keeper. The Powerplay is doing more bad than good for Bangladesh.

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Bravo b Samuels 21 (21b 0x4 1x6 17m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Samuels has taken the Mickey out of the innings. Rahim top-edges the sweep off a flat ball and it nestles in short fine leg's hands. Darren Bravo takes a catch, which is an event by itself.

headshotImage.caption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alok Kapali c Simmons b Rampaul 20 (24b 1x4 0x6 32m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: and that's the end of Kapali. Rampaul excels in these skiddy bouncers that come along faster than you'd imagine. Kapali top-edges a pull and it is easily caught well inside the boundary by a pumped up Simmons.

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain b Russell 9 (9b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: huge offcutter. Russell gets it to dart in late and cut Nasir in half as he thinks of cutting, then steering, then defending. He was probably better off working it to the leg side. It ends up going off the bat handle onto the stumps.

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Shakib cuts the last ball straight to point, and that's the end of that.

commentPostTextItems.html: That's it from us for tonight. On behalf of the crew at ESPNcricinfo, this is Nitin Sundar signing off. Cheers.

Rahim: "After winning the toss we were expecting more from the wicket. The bowlers didn't bowl too well and there were some hiccups in our fielding as well. Full credit to WI for the way they played. We have been practising for the last one month with the new rules. There was no turn in the wicket so our spinners found it tough. We need to find some way of bowling with the two new balls."

Simmons, as expected, is Man of the Match for his fine century. That gives West Indies a 1-0 lead in the three-game series. Bangladesh will need some intent if they want to come back in this series. It will be all too easy for West Indies if the hosts look to play for stumps when they are chasing.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

commentTextItems.html: gets a single this time, full toss on off, mishit to mid-off.
full and wide of off stump, Razzak looks to carve through the off side and misses.
another pull to the deep for a single. The ball is coming on quite well even now. If only the Bangladesh top-order hadn't sleep-walked for 25 overs ...
short ball to Razzak, who pulls to the deep for another single.
perfect yorker outside off, Shakib digs it out to the off side for a single.
same ball, same shot. Another miss outside off stump.

commentPostTextItems.html: 45 off 6. You'd back the Windies to win this one.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

commentTextItems.html: backs away and tries to pull a ball from wide of off stump. No connection made.
worked off the pads to deep square leg for one.
Russell bowls a wide as he attempts the bouncer.
length from Russell, Razzak hauls it away to deep square leg for one.

commentPostTextItems.html: "Cut Nasir in half as he thinks of cutting, then steering, then defending" ....haha, he probably was thinking whats for dinner too, maybe where to go for a few drinks with the boys" That from Tariq again.

commentTextItems.html: Shakib pulls a short ball to deep midwicket for one more.

Shakib keeps trying, drives powerfully into the covers. Bishoo tags it valianrly and manages to save the boundary, but the relay thrower wasted his effort by conceding an overthrow for the fourth run. Bishoo seems to have hurt his leg in the process.
boundary at long last. Razzak gets some timing away through midwicket for four.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Kemar Roach player portrait
image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

commentTextItems.html: low full toss, driven to deep covers for a single.
cut off the back foot through backward point for a couple more.
short ball again, Razzak hauls it away to deep third man for one.
wide of off stump, Razzak toe ends a swipe without timing.
slow short offcutter, Shakib miscues the pull to midwicket. The speed gun says 84 kph. Even Shakib bowls faster than that most of the time.
Razzak attempts the big drive into the off side and misses.

dismissalComment.html: Danza's taken a blinder! Slow offcutter from Naeem, who backs away and swings merrily, but the ball comes on slowly and takes the top edge to fly right up. Hyatt runs back from cover, dives away from the action and takes it with both hands even as he slides along the turf. Supreme stuff.

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c †Ramdin b Samuels 42 (52b 5x4 0x6 68m) SR: 80.76

dismissalComment.html: Kayes' lively hand comes to an end, and it is that man Samuels again. Short ball outside off, it came on faster than he expected and he ended up feathering the cut to the keeper. The Powerplay is doing more bad than good for Bangladesh.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Ashraful c †Ramdin b Rampaul 2 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Ashraful is on his way already. Blink-and-you-miss innings. Nice lively bouncer from Rampaul, Ashraful goes for a shot he wouldn't have tried if it wasn't the Powerplay, or if the situation wasn't so difficult (though, with Ashraful, it is tough to say). He's cramped for the pull and  Ramdin takes the top edge.

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan not out 67 (58b 2x4 1x6 87m) SR: 115.51
Mushfiqur Rahim c Bravo b Samuels 21 (21b 0x4 1x6 17m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Samuels has taken the Mickey out of the innings. Rahim top-edges the sweep off a flat ball and it nestles in short fine leg's hands. Darren Bravo takes a catch, which is an event by itself.

headshotImage.caption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alok Kapali player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alok Kapali c Simmons b Rampaul 20 (24b 1x4 0x6 32m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: and that's the end of Kapali. Rampaul excels in these skiddy bouncers that come along faster than you'd imagine. Kapali top-edges a pull and it is easily caught well inside the boundary by a pumped up Simmons.

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain b Russell 9 (9b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: huge offcutter. Russell gets it to dart in late and cut Nasir in half as he thinks of cutting, then steering, then defending. He was probably better off working it to the leg side. It ends up going off the bat handle onto the stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak not out 8 (13b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 61.53

huge offcutter. Russell gets it to dart in late and cut Nasir in half as he thinks of cutting, then steering, then defending. He was probably better off working it to the leg side. It ends up going off the bat handle onto the stumps.

headshotImage.caption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: what a gift. Bishoo strikes with his first ball. It was short, it was wide, and it was barely turning in. Tamim set himself up for a sumptuous cut, and edged it into Ramdin's gloves.

notes: West Indies innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 47 runs, 0 wicket)
West Indies: 50 runs in 10.6 overs (66 balls), Extras 3
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 66 balls (LMP Simmons 36, AB Barath 11, Ex 3)
AB Barath retired hurt at 67/0 (21, 14.6 overs)
Powerplay 2: Overs 15.1 - 20.0 (Bowling side - 23 runs, 0 wicket)
LMP Simmons: 50 off 53 balls (4 x 4)
West Indies: 100 runs in 22.5 overs (137 balls), Extras 3
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 69 balls (LMP Simmons 27, MN Samuels 23, Ex 0)
West Indies: 150 runs in 32.5 overs (197 balls), Extras 3
Powerplay 3: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 46 runs, 0 wicket)
1st Wicket: 100 runs in 122 balls (LMP Simmons 55, MN Samuels 45, Ex 0)
LMP Simmons: 100 off 112 balls (4 x 4, 2 x 6)
Drinks: West Indies - 174/0 in 37.0 overs (LMP Simmons 100, MN Samuels 50)
MN Samuels: 50 off 63 balls (4 x 4, 1 x 6)
West Indies: 200 runs in 39.4 overs (238 balls), Extras 8
1st Wicket: 150 runs in 155 balls (LMP Simmons 79, MN Samuels 65, Ex 6)
West Indies: 250 runs in 44.6 overs (270 balls), Extras 9
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 35 balls (DM Bravo 18, KA Pollard 32, Ex 0)
Innings Break: West Indies - 298/4 in 50.0 overs (DP Hyatt 6, AD Russell 7)
Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 40 runs, 0 wicket)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 13.2 overs (80 balls), Extras 8
Powerplay 2: Overs 15.1 - 20.0 (Bowling side - 26 runs, 0 wicket)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 70/1 in 18.0 overs (Naeem Islam 25, Imrul Kayes 15)
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 66 balls (Naeem Islam 24, Imrul Kayes 25, Ex 1)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 24.5 overs (149 balls), Extras 10
Powerplay 3: Overs 25.1 - 30.0 (Batting side - 29 runs, 3 wickets)
Naeem Islam: 50 off 78 balls (4 x 4)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 33.3 overs (201 balls), Extras 10
Drinks: Bangladesh - 164/5 in 35.4 overs (Shakib Al Hasan 16)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 41.3 overs (249 balls), Extras 12
6th Wicket: 50 runs in 41 balls (Shakib Al Hasan 29, Alok Kapali 19, Ex 2)
Shakib Al Hasan: 50 off 44 balls (2 x 4, 1 x 6)
Bangladesh: 250 runs in 48.1 overs (289 balls), Extras 15

milestones.description: This is the highest match aggregate (556) involving teams West Indies & Bangladesh in ODIs

stories.title: Simmons pleased with 'special knock'
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 1st ODI, Mirpur: Simmons pleased with 'special knock'
stories.summary: Lendl Simmons finally made his first international hundred and, with the help of Marlon Samuels, powered West Indies to a total that proved too much for Bangladesh

image.caption: Lendl Simmons poses with the Man-of-the-Match award
image.longCaption: Lendl Simmons poses with the Man-of-the-Match award, Bangladesh v West Indies, 1st ODI, Mirpur, October 13, 2011
